page.title: 03Leisure in Boreham Wood
page.content: There is an indoor swimming pool which has a sauna. The pool is used by 3000 people a week with 2000 school children having weekly swimming lessons. Close by is the Civic Hall where films are shown, plays produced and meetings held. Its restaurant is open during the day. In addition to books the library lends records and music tapes. Some tapes contain fiction books for listening to and there is a section of books in large type for the partially sighted. There are also sessions of story times for young children. The library offers a photocopying service at 5p a copy. There is a sports centre in the grounds of Nicholas Hawksmoor School which was built in 1977. The centre is used by the school and is open to the public in the evenings, weekends and school holidays.
